ZXN6u65cDCK4SPi6aQNPrw.text: As an American visiting London and staying in Notting Hill, I found this place to be outstanding. My buddy and I had a busy day of touring around the city with our significant others. The ladies didn't want to go out for the evening so he and I wandered around the neighborhood and found this place. We were not disappointed. The food, beer, and ambiance was all top notch. I want to go back to London just to go here again.

ARPmfvtUg7XB5mL9y21EkA.text: A pub that can pull off excellent oysters, a good pint and stays buzzy from the afternoon into the evening, I love.  It's definitely very popular given it is always packed but you will not be disappointed.

czYsElx9jq8jHH4L3DT7aQ.text: I've only been to the charming and cosy pub downstairs, but it's definitely a neighbourhood favourite. They pull a great pint of Guinness and their coffee isn't bad too, surprisingly. My only quibble is that they don't serve much (any?) vegetarian food in the pub. I've been stuck eating side dishes there. If you're going for a drink you're best off going early to get any of their few seats.

Ze17JtvgwLyCiBTHMwsZng.text: Smashing restaurant with decent wine list. Good value for money.

kOlmPFPPcZzihF5bMO7LtQ.text: great litlle pub .i travelled quite far to get their but it was worth it,nice pints and nice atmosphere .we had food in the bar oysters and half a pint of prawns good choice for starter.my main course of crab linguine was a bit drab but the baked seabream was much better.dessrt of sticky toffee pud was served cold which was wierd was not up to much.great place to meet a friend or two eat some seafood and have pint and a chat.

AbvUxz1cnTbjGDcuk1cKaw.text: The Cow is a beautiful pub and i don't often describe pubs as being 'beautiful'! I love the location (near Portobello Road and Westbourne Park), I love the style of the pub and restaurant, i love the atmosphere and most of all i love the food. They have amazing seafood on the menu. Last time i visited i had their venison starter which was delicious and for main i had pumpkin and goats cheese ravioli-i don't often choose pasta dishes when i eat out but i saw someone else eating it and it looked great so i had to try it! Their partridge is gorgeous too though. The food menu is like that of a good restaurant and the prices are to match but then again the food is worth the price you pay here. I would only eat here when i want to (or others want to) treat myself. If you're into cigars then this place would be great for you as i've heard they specialise in Cuban cigars. The bar is quite small but it provides a great atmosphere and in the summer it's perfect to have a pint outside in their out door seating area. There's always a lively local buzz to the place on a warm summers evening.

9L4M7HcrfOaVjeF0wQjT-Q.text: Great pub with upstairs dining room. If you are brave enough to face the crowds and the noise then eating downstairs is way more fun.The food is delicious. I had oysters and the grilled squid salad. 4 stars because the wait staff varied between being a little rude and a lot rude.  I am not sure if they were just busy but I have to knock off at least a star for that.

0sNG0EhcMO29i67Fh2UgjQ.text: This is a tiny little pub (with a less appealing upstairs) that has almost become as well known for its excellent food as its great drinking atmosphere.If it's not freezing outside, the crowd usually spills out onto the sidewalk/street as it is nearly impossible to fit more than 25 or so people comfortably inside (at the bar area).  The miniature back "room" - and several tables up front - is dedicated to diners.The food really is excellent.  There are always specials, but refreshingly, a number of items on the menu are consistently available.  The Cow's oysters get rave reviews (deservedly), as does the fish stew (my husband dreams of this), and I once had a plate of venison as good as any found in the most high-end restaurant.Prices are very reasonable.

aph3WEGLJ3dZFgfooc9MBg.text: The Cow is one of my favourite winter pubs. The place is dark and cosy and is often packed so its best to go early. The fish stew is the best dish on the menu down at the bar and is the main reason I go to the Cow. It's a nice hearty dish, especially in winter.

ubs9umszkz7-KZ02AMh68w.text: A great pub. You bump into so many locals, the sheer buzz inside (and out during the summer) is worth the trip alone. You can crawl out of bed and amble over and spend a few hours. By the time you've left, you'll have chatted to tables either side and 3 tables along, and everyone will exchange email addresses (and possible phone numbers, too!..) It must have been the wine

B2BSWswWxDXScZy1_71hcQ.text: This pub near Westborne Grove tube is a very popular place - cosy atmosphere & a good place for oysters and guinness. The place itself is very casual (wooden tables, bit scruffy) but at the same time very nice. Worth going for a casual drink.

3vbYvnPCvDC0pPZbr86ufw.text: Short review:Oyster sampler was yummy!The sea food stew was to die for!!Bitter chocolate marquis was okay.Nice atmosphere but the staff wasn't very kind.Had to wait at the dining area by myself for 15 minutes as nobody was there.The server didn't really recommended anything.He said their menu changes all the time and everything is good.But to me, it sounds like "I haven't tried our food yet"Well, other than that, I had a great time there. Definitely going back to try the same seafood stew again!!

4qVHImcsXJJK8swC_ve8cw.text: Favourite pub in london. Sea food at its best. Great steak for meat lovers. Real irish gastro pub. I always come here while in London.

HNXLgQEcA0soUDheun9_2Q.text: I came because a friend who used to work here in the past recomended the place, and i can say it was a great recomendation, food looked great, I wasn't looking for a complete meal, more something to have whit drink, so I ordered "the cow special" 6 oysters (big ones) and a pint of gunness

PMQtnnrCYav53_IuHolfCQ.text: Oysters, beer, and lovely food accompanied our enjoyable Sunday afternoon hanging in the back end of this very cool pub. Normally this place is teeming with people, but just after Noon things were very calm and relaxed.We had the Irish Rocks to start. I had the onglet with potatoes dauphinoise and the hubs had the duck with mange-tout. Both were done to perfection. All washed down with Czech beer and a lovely sauv blanc. I can't wait to come back here for lunch. Haven't decided yet, whether I'm willing to wade through the evening crowds, though. Perhaps this winter when they crank up the lovely wood-burning stove in the back.

ww6FJQ77rTBdC7wMvyLS2w.text: Place is nice. Pub downstairs and dining room on 1st floor. Service is really sloooooow. I tried the fish stew that some reviewers say it is great. Mine was tasteless. At least prices are decent.

OFk8Q8bcpbmIUAZsp_iB_g.text: Love this place. Great atmosphere, good food and many kinds of beer. A hidden gem in London.

Ie48iEnUhbBDsOGClNvCbw.text: No, I haven't been to EVERY gastropub in London and no, I'm not a Londoner, so my experience is based on the one time that I've been there and the food was nothing short of miraculous. THE BEST FISH STEW I'VE EVER HAD ANYWHERE - rich tomato based shellfish broth with all sorts of fish mixed in. Also had the razor clams as a starter and also delicious. My partner had the Crab Tagliolini and if I wasn't full from my lunch I would have eaten that too. It's the kind of meal that one could easily use to rationalize making another costly trip back to London from NYC for. That said, I'd recommend going for lunch when you don't have heaps of happy hour standing over you while you eat your food. And BEWARE: the quaint upstairs dining room does not feature the superb pub menu. They should really change that.

eSSy0TejUN5wnD-8dCe5OQ.text: This was my favorite gastropub whilst I was living in London, which makes no sense since I lived in Islington, but I happened to walk into this place when I was visiting years before, and I've always had a special affection for it. Yes, the food really is good, it's wonderfully cozy with a great pub atmosphere - everyone is having fun in there and you want to too. I personally like Guinness everywhere, but I had a few Irish friends who aren't as open-minded as I am, and were impressed at The Cow being the first place they liked it outside of Ireland. If you're not on a strict student's budget I definitely recommend heading to The Cow, and if I'm lucky enough to live in London again, it'll be my local all over again.

X4YmIQw1UH06QInCwgYi6w.text: The Cow is very popular and competes for business with the equally busy Westbourne Pub across the road. If you love fish then their seafood platters are a must. A visit to The Cow wouldnt be the same without me trying their pint of prawns in mayonaise- YUMMYHowever if fish is not your thing then try not to sit near the bar because there always seems to be a distinct fishy smell.The venue really is compact so it's best to get here late afternoon/ early evening if you can.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cow - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Cow - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Cow - London, United Kingdom

KRC9ThhM3TRzzKb6SUiYGA.text: The Cow has quickly become my favourite pub since moving to Notting Hill. The atmosphere is warm and friendly and it is easy to see why it is a big hit with all the locals who are fun. I haven't tried the food yet, but many seem obsessed with the fish stew. I've been very impressed with the wine, Guiness and whisky on offer. Overall, the fun and friendliness of this place is what really makes it and the standards are very good.

naOSI5h2z6o4bY0PXccnYw.text: This place was happening when we went on a Saturday eve.  We thought that at 9:45 we would have no problem getting a table in the dining room upstairs, but space is limited and that was a no-go, but I was kind of happy about that because the upstairs looked refined, formal and a bit old.  We ended up luckily scoring 2 seats at the bar, and the menu down there is different.  We had a spaghetti with crab and chili and a seasonal salad--both were good, but nothing to rave about.   The crowd was rowdy and happy but friendly.  The music included every genre you could imagine.  Service was fine.Hoping to go back and eat the upstairs food that everyone was raving about, but probably on a weekday with a booking.

eb0yNA-HIOHK04H35I65Hw.text: Phenomenal neighborhood pub with a strong food and raw bar menu to boot.

SCSIaOeipKTw9BksToyrCA.text: The Cow Get a thumbs up from me...I must say i found it all rather interesting that a place calling itself 'The Cow' has a big neon sign saying Guinness and Oysters over the door and pictures that grace the walls the educate the drinker/diner on how well Guinness and seafood do actually go together?!?! Who Knew..A lot of the menu is seafood which they excel at, and while I am usually not a fan of being able to see the kitchen from the table, in this instance i think it works very well..the kitchen is tiny! Be warned tho - tho portions are MAHOOSIVE..especially the entrees.. I ordered the goats cheese and pumpkin salad to start with and it was big enough to qualify for a main meal in its own right!

nMqN85w9LJMJwQEo0bCkVA.text: I LOVE this pub. Two words- FISH STEW! Oh and how could I forget the Laughing Cow stickers that grace every napkin! It's the little things..

kFmKR5TsPBFV0vltfxsd8g.text: The fish soup at The Cow is delicious and deserves a mention. The poor service, bad lighting, iffy food and apallingly mannered drinkers and diners also deserve a mention. We may have caught The Cow on a bad day . . . We may have not sampled some of the best dishes on its menu (3 of us went for the Beef pie which was watery and bland) - though one of us did plump for the fish soup (which I also tasted) and it deserves to be lauded, it was good. The owners can't do much about the overbearingly drunk and rude 'trust fund' scions that seemed intent on taking over The Cow at everyone else's expense the night we went there. The owners can do something about the poor service and the variable food.

bMvyKm6lppXkwAYF7y2G9w.text: I chose this place for my birthday dinner on the strength of the Yelp reviews.  I have a baby and, owing to this, we were seated in the 2nd floor dining room -- much more sedate than the packed pub downstairs.We opened with an appetizer of razor clams with chorizo on rocket, which was quite tasty and portended well.  However, we both made mistakes with our entrees -- my wife had a bland fish and chips (the chips/fries were clearly right out of a bag) and I had a bland coq au vin on mashed potatoes.  The chicken was tender, which I'll give them credit for.  However, the lack of flavor was so bad that by about halfway through I was dreading each new forkful.  I turned my attention to the peas with mint, which were decent, and the draught cider from the pub downstairs, which was good.  We finished by splitting a cream-gelatin with strawberry syrup (the name escapes me at the moment).  The cream-gelatin was quite good, the strawberries had seen better days, and the syrup was overly sugary.The servers were very pleasant but not attentive in the least -- very difficult to get their attention. I come from the States, so this may be a national difference.Very underwhelming.  Our best experience was with the clams, so I suggest you take other peoples' advice and stick with the seafood.

fBtVIBlZhu5Et6EW6PRXGQ.text: Great food and the week night specials are particularly good value. One of the best pints of Guinness in London. Shame the service isn't as great as the rest of the pub, but it's forgivable as everything else is so good.

dF4cJYmA7iO_0tICka6UmQ.text: Beautiful, old school irish pub that always has decent music and great seafood. Downstairs is quite small, so not good for large groups. There is an upstairs but it lacks atmosphere, downstairs is where its at.

M_RQgJ2uOgWnKEyWjS2BMQ.text: This is a great, cosy little pub just off Portobello Road with a beautiful interior; particularly the dining area. And dining is what this place is known for; platters of oysters are ingested by hungry friends, lovers and patrons.They are famous around London and (so I'm told) deservedly so. The Cow is always jam packed full of drinkers and eaters, especially in the summer. They have a wonderful section at the back of the pub that gets cordoned off when it's not dining time. A really nice place to pop in for a glass of wine and a snack, a definite change from the norm.

-JTiYgO9in_ObH2fRF3alg.text: The Cow is probably my favourite pub in London. A typical Irish pub recreated by Tom Conran on the ground floor with a few tables at the back (and a proper restaurant above it). The crowd is different from the Westbourne, more trendy local and less flashy than the Westbourne. The location facing North makes its small terrasse less attractive but there is always a lively crowd around the Cow and lots of activity at the bar where the two most served beers are Red Stripe and Guinness illustrating the mix of Irish and local Carabbean cultures. The menu is small but go there for the sea food, the even have a great sea food platter if you are really hungry.The restaurant above is small but excellent with a great atmosphere and a menu that changes regularly. Booking essential and it is probably quite expensive too (say £45 per head).

KfUx1c_Q20m_J1sVi0nPRg.text: Yes, yes, and yes!  Wonderful place for fish and Italian food.  Great beers on tap.  The cook is Italian and they make their own pasta.  This place has a Todays Special menu with a wide choice range.  They also have a Dish Du Jour weekly special Monday through Friday.  Each day features a delicious dish.  They also serve fresh oysters.  The fishStop on in for a great meal.

6BD5_5jWBPeDIWDu6xQNMQ.text: Well , feeling hungry and ready to eat.We walk in ask if it's the ok to sit , yeah anywhere!Ok..Menus ? Ohhh uh geez ok !!Then ignores us we look straight at her as we're ready to order a drink a meal...She looks away no I'm busy polishing the utensils.It's a small place and if I'm mistaken then I'm an extremely poor judge of a non resolvable situation We walk out as she smirked with satisfaction.Great food shit service

ROxRDkq_91wyF_gGtafMSg.text: This hidden gem in Notting Hill was a surprise. This is a local pub that has ridiculous fresh seafood. I know they have other menu items because I saw others ordering but I had to have the tower of seafood!  Oysters, shrimp and escargot, what more could you ask for.....well a few pints of beer. Lol.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cow - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Cow - London, United Kingdom

nYqWFbP1y3C9LsXuMY8TAw.text: Cleverly disguised as a rustic saloon bar, The Cow is actually a fine gastropub serving fresh, inspired food. The interior is small and cozy, with wooden tables pushed closely together, romantic dim lighting, and classic rock tunes playing from an antique jukebox. Eclectic vintage hand painted signs and photo cover the walls. I came here with my boyfriend for dinner, and we were seated immediately. To be completely honest, as a vegan person, I came here with low expectations. Perusing the menu, nearly everything contains meat or fish. However, I was so charmed by the ambience that I was happy to just drink (especially with Guinness now being 100% vegan)!Our server was friendly, and happy to speak to the chef about preparing a vegan meal for me. Fortunately, he was very accommodating, and I received a delicious pasta dish with a bright, slightly spicy tomato sauce that was absolutely incredible. We also got sides of fresh bread and Cornish new potatoes, both of which were excellent and paired perfectly with the food and wine. The high quality of ingredients and expert preparation of the food was evident, and appreciated. To drink we shared a bottle of the Corbieres Syrah, which was lovely and reasonably priced at £34. My boyfriend has been here many times and raves about the Seafood Stew, so if you are not vegan, order that. I look forward to returning the next time I am in London.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cow - London, United Kingdom. Interior

nXczZEZXDxhcLVv-ly2Ldg.text: I enjoyed this bar of all the pubs in London that I had ever visited and we are talking quite a few I never met any Group of people more set on being curious as to know who you are where you are from how much money you have and why you are stopping by their beloveds pubAm I London tourist I've been there enough times to no longer call myself really a touristBut I just happen to end up there and I was just around the area and happen to run into Robert Pattinsons his flat. I've always had a crush on him I took a picture in front of his door for shits and giggles and pretty much just ran away with excitement and when I ended up at this bar I happened to mention that I was excited because I was at Robert Pattinson's flat and the entire table got so hungry with me saying that they couldn't stand him And that they were angry that he bought a flat in that area of Notting Hill they thought he was a sell-out doing all of those stupid Twilight movies I agreed with them on that part but when they told me that Robert Pattinson was welcome and there are kind of broke my heartI mean there was good service at this restaurant and some cool people hanging out you can tell me lived around the area I bought a round of drinks and I think I spent about £110 lol But it ended up evening out because everyone else at the table so thankful to have such great conversation with me that they paid for my shutter particular and drinks for the rest of the eveningI just can't believe London pubs close at 11 PM that's worse than Los AngelesI'm from Las Vegas where booze is available 24 hours a day so it's very hard for me to adapt to the London nightlifeI'm sorry I had to throw in the London drama of my Robert Pattinson story but I couldn't believe that the people that normally go to this pub or heating on to Robert Pattinson so badPlease be nice to him I love himI'm in the New York area right now temporarily he is here all weekI may be on Yelp with some dramatic story if I decide to stalk him this week in New York City I'm undecided

photos.caption: Photo of The Cow - London, United Kingdom. The Robert Pattinson hating posse

-SGdW1UjObuIsOanfgvXIQ.text: Horrible ServiceCow fish stew was disgustingWaitress was rude. She was forgetting to serve, smile, and take care of her customers ~But she was sure having a good time talking to her fellow workers rather than help or attend her customers ~Food was just despicable. Not edible and gross.Seating area so small people sit on top of you.Just horrible and  it is a terrible bar if you want anything but a beer. Do not go here!  London has tons if other amazing pubs

4YFAAcOjS4q_Nq52uAE1qA.text: Very bad service. The food I ordered never arrived and when I went asking for explanations they just said there was a mistake and did not even apologized nor offer to speed up a new order. There are so many other nice pubs in the area that there is really no reason to focus on this one ..

Q09ZTRCJP7zVgWh4z_tHDA.text: Wow. Can't say enough good things about this place.  I walked in and was immediately greeted by a very friendly guy and his dog. Did he own the place? No he did not. Just a patron. That is the Cow. By the end of the night I felt like a regular. Best Guinness outside of Dublin. Food was good and after meeting half the bar and buying many drinks eating a great meal the bill came and I was surprised on how little it was. Great atmosphere, great people, great time.

K9-bKQxDaw5lycWDvOvbww.text: Excellent. I had the fish stew, which was really superb, but all elements of the meal were very high quality.   Ate upstairs, great service, a lively atmosphere for a wonderful meal. Enjoy!

BS4jDoQ6q7e3Bk0x662jlQ.text: Excellent in every way had the duck was probably best ever. Ate upstairs and the oyster soup was awesome.

1sTQEhWRS7kEsPYgiNnidw.text: I love this place. My most recent visit was on a cold Saturday night in January. Luckily for us, even at 8 PM the upstairs dining room wasn't very crowded. It started to fill up around 10 PM when we were leaving.My other half and I sat at a communal table, but had it to ourselves until about the time the check arrived. I really enjoyed my Cow Pie, which was a heavenly dish of steak spiked with a Guinness sauce in a flaky crust. My other half had the steak special. I was lucky enough to try a few bites, and it's one of the best steaks I've tasted in London. It was certainly on par with offerings from some of the American steakhouses. The restaurant was so small that one waiter covered the entire floor, yet service was efficient and friendly. They also have a nice wine list. Definitely give it a try sometime!

N5AmU67q3vX_lWutnP7qDw.text: Sort of random for a place to be called the cow and not focus on meat.  The fish was very good as were the oysters.  We sat upstairs, which was quiet and relatively romantic.

q4O3ZLlFDUmVxyxtlS2aEw.text: While having a pub that's seven tube stops away from your flat as your local kind of defeats the purpose of a local, I'm thinking of making an exception for The Cow.Why?First, it's the only place outside Dublin I've had a pint of Guinness and enjoyed it.Second, the atmosphere is raucous and loud and you want to be a part of it. You'll find suits slurping oysters, peeps in t-shirts buying rounds of shots and barkeeps who are all about facilitating your fun. Also, The Cow's soundtrack is totally awesome. Third, the kitchen is the size of a small closet and yet, magic happens there. Skill, that's what you've gotta have to make that work!Oh, and, the flags from all over the world hung up around the place just make me happy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cow - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Cow - London, United Kingdom

b0VIvWXghMOaYTfDhEr05A.text: Probably the best 'gastro pub' I've been to. Only it's not a gastro pub, it's a solid boozer, which happens to serve great homemade food upstairs. Loved every dish i was served, from the pint of Guinness, to the half pint of prawns and then the crab pasta. Service isn't quick but if that bothers you, you don't get it. Just enjoy the vibe, drink some beers and look forward to the next dish. Value is good with specials mon-thurs. Portions are good too. My only slightly dislike was that the crab pasta was slightly too spicy, but that might just be me. Enjoy !

photos.caption: Photo of The Cow - London, United Kingdom. Shuck it !

ZwyxlX-yFnVhjtUSq0wufw.text: This is a serious fish restaurant in the guise of a local pub.  I had a crab and fish stew.  Both were expertly prepared, and the fish was obviously right off the boat.  It is well worth the long and dangerous trip from my house (ok, it's a three minute walk).

NFpmLf2Dg12q8VOC21TUdg.text: I dont know why the fish stew has received so many great reviews...I found the broth a bit bland and not savoury.  on the flip side, they have the best damn rock oysters I've ever eaten. Super plump, succulent, large, meaty and very fresh. Same goes for the half pint of prawns...filled past the rim and the interior of the pint was jam packed with these fresh lil' guys. Prawns and oysters tasted like they just came from the wharf. Hands down the best pub I've eaten at in all of England.  If you like fresh seafood, a relaxed pub environment, and value, this is your place. I predict I will be eating here at least once a week and will definitely bring all of my out-of-town friends.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cow - London, United Kingdom. Crab Tagliatelle
Photo of The Cow - London, United Kingdom. Chicken Kiev
Photo of The Cow - London, United Kingdom. Perfect pint of Guinness

JM1K3C2tjUjtM_9VH0geag.text: My favourite gastropub in London.  Seafood is king here. Crab and Chilli Tagliolini is a weekly occurrence for me, so is the fish stew (think Bouillabaisse).  Rocks are solid (try w/ Guinness) and the whole cracked crab is awesome if you have the skill ;)Always a good Chablis by the bottle and a nice Ribera del Duero if you need a red.

photos.caption: Photo of The Cow - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Cow - London, United Kingdom. pint of prawns + pint of Guiness

H56xgX0ic9bJPSJM7s2BDA.text: Wow. I was not expecting that. We ordered oysters and the seafood soup and it was incredible. I can't recommend this place enough. There's nothing like paying for an expensive meal and it being so-so. This was reasonable and the quality was much above the price.Also they had dogs inside and out which is really cool. Dog friendly and delicious.

KG0oguaqXC3d9FdiDWD-_w.text: The best authentic pub in London. We walked in as four American ladies and felt "the regular" vibe right away. We thought one beer and we'll go. Then we started chatting and it turned into the most welcoming bar we've ever visited! We made quick friends with the staff and were laughing and drinking for hours to come. Even if you're not in the area, this pub is a MUST visit and feel the real authentic vibe of a pub that hasn't changed in 20 years regardless of its neighborhood status.

18W28jcyUC_d_I92BZTlyA.text: One of the first true gastropubs in London. Book well in advance. Get the sticky toffee pudding.
